result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 30, 2022 at 10:45 am.
to Address Non-Monetary Conditions of Bond Based on the Victim's Request

1:46 PM Defendant Ricky Reyes appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert appeared by phone for Ricky Reyes.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
Defense filed a bond modification yesterday- requesting bond amount be lowered to $15,000-$20,000. The state request the court deny the motion. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Court denies the bond motion.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on January 10, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
to Reduce Cash Bail - defense

ADDRESS INFO for Ricky Reyes
Current: 4319 Morning View Ct #J106, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 1702 Alexander Court, Sheboygan, WI 53081

3:02 PM Defendant Ricky Reyes in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher M. Eippert in court for Ricky Reyes.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Det. R. Rupnik sworn and testified. Defense stipulates to identification for today's hearing. State requests bindover. Defense objects to bindover and requests dismissal and also requests an arraignment date. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Atty Eippert requests a cash bond of $100,000.00 which is more than on the bond motion. State objects to both cash and monetary bond conditions. Court lower cash bond to $100,000.00 with addl conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Arraignment on October 19, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

Have no contact with female juveniles.
Remain within the State of Wisconsin. 
Comply with day reporting requirements - GPS
Defendant may not discuss the case with ESD.
